page.title: 07 THE LOST VILLAGE
page.content: During 1956 a farmer was ploughing his field at Green farm, Shorne, when a piece of 14th century coffin slab was uncovered. A similar find had been made 20 years before. This find led to the discovery of the whereabouts of Merston church, part of Merston village which had once been a Saxon settlement. The piece of coffin slab is now kept at Higham primary school. Merston village was mentioned in the original domesday book. The remains of Merston church are not visible but because of certain findings its exact position is now known. Some tiles and flints from the church can also be seen. The site of the village of Merston is now used as agricultural land by the Lower Shorne farmers, Ferry and Houghton.
